title: 110_s296
content: Clarification of cash accounting rules for small businesses. Cash Accounting Permitted for Certain Small Business Taxpayers without Limitation under Section 446 of the Internal Revenue Code. Eligible taxpayers are not required to use accrual method if they meet specific criteria. Expansion of gross receipts test under section 448(b) of the Internal Revenue Code to increase the threshold from $5,000,000 to $10,000,000. Conforming amendments made to section 448(c) to reflect the new threshold and include an inflation adjustment provision. Inflation adjustment for taxable years after 2007, dollar amounts in subsections increased based on cost-of-living adjustment. Inventory rules clarified for small businesses under Section 471 of the Internal Revenue Code. Section 471 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to allow small business taxpayers to not use inventories for a taxable year. Qualified taxpayers are defined as those who do not use inventories for certain properties after December 31, 2006. The term 'qualified taxpayer' is defined as any eligible taxpayer or any taxpayer described in specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code. Amendments are made to certain sections of the Code, and these changes apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. When a taxpayer changes their accounting method, it is considered initiated by the taxpayer and made with the consent of the Secretary of the Treasury. The adjustments required under the Internal Revenue Code must be spread out over a period not exceeding 4 taxable years.
